intro: Oreodoxa frigida, commonly known as the Antarctic pearlwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica and the southernmost regions of South America. Its botanical features reflect its evolutionary adaptations to survive in one of the most challenging ecosystems on Earth.
